name: aileen
cooked: The Open Source Hardware Association is taking input on the proposal for an open hardware certification in this forum. This thread is devoted to question # 3, which reads: “Should it be possible for projects with non-open components to be certified as open source hardware? If so, how should the process handle such projects? Is a part-by-part label desirable because it gives specificity or undesirable because it complicates understanding the label for less technically sophisticated community members?” For other question forums, as well as a general comment forum, click [here].
raw: The Open Source Hardware Association is taking input on the proposal for an open hardware certification in this forum. This thread is devoted to question # 3, which reads: "Should it be possible for projects with non-open components to be certified as open source hardware? If so, how should the process handle such projects? Is a part-by-part label desirable because it gives specificity or undesirable because it complicates understanding the label for less technically sophisticated community members?" For other question forums, as well as a general comment forum, click [here].
